elements.name: introduction
elements.html:
Introduction

Assessing the risk of a feature/story without having any code written is a hard thing to do. The majority of the value in this exercise should come from the fact that a general idea about the impact that a particular change may have in the Prod environment allows Product Teams to have a meaningful discussion with the Appsec team in order to determine if there is anything inherently wrong from a security perspective before moving on with the actual implementation.

Prerequisites

Please make sure you are familiar with OWASP Top 10.This will be an important reference during the risk assessment process

elements.name: risk_assessment_guide
elements.html:
Definitions

- Threat: Flaw that results in compromise of Confidentiality, Integrity or Availability
- Risk: Potential for loss due to some vulnerability being exploited
- Mitigation: The measures in place to help prevent a vulnerability.
- Confidentiality:: Confidentiality is the protection of data against unauthorized disclosure, or otherwise put, it is about ensuring that only those with the correct authorization can access the data. Confidentiality applies to data at rest, but also to data in motion
- Integrity:: Integrity is about protecting data against unauthorized modification, or assuring data trustworthiness
- Availability:: Availability is about ensuring the presence of information or resources.

elements.name: confidentiality
elements.title: Confidentiality:  Suppose an attacker would be able to find a vulnerability that is introduced as part of this change and successfully exploit it.  Confidentiality is about protecting the information from being exposed to an unauthorized party. Would the exploitation of a potential vulnerability in this component lead to loss of Confidentiality?

choices.text: I am not sure

elements.name: integrity
elements.title: Integrity: Suppose an attacker would be able to find a vulnerability that is introduced as part of this change, and successfully exploit it.  Integrity is about protecting data from being modified by an unauthorized party. Would the exploitation of a potential vulnerability in this component lead to loss of Integrity?

choices.text: I am not sure

elements.name: availability
elements.title: Availability: Suppose an attacker would be able to find a vulnerability that is introduced as part of this change and successfully exploit it.  Availability means that information is accessible to authorized users, i.e. that data is accessible by authorized users whenever it's needed. Would the exploitation of a potential vulnerability in this component lead to loss of Availability?

choices.text: I am not sure
